dcterms:creator: A. Williams
N. Nangia
S. R. Bowman
dcterms:description: The MNLI dataset contains pairs of premise and hypothesis sentences labeled as entailment, neutral, and contradiction. It is used to evaluate models trained on MNLI against the challenge dataset HANS.
dcterms:title: MNLI

dcterms:creator: T. McCoy
E. Pavlick
T. Linzen
dcterms:description: The HANS dataset contains examples of high overlap between premises and hypothetical sentences but are labeled as contradiction. It is used to evaluate models trained on MNLI.
dcterms:title: HANS

dcterms:creator: S. R. Bowman
G. Angeli
C. Potts
C. D. Manning
dcterms:description: The SNLI dataset contains pairs of premise and hypothesis sentences labeled as entailment, neutral, and contradiction. It is used to evaluate models trained on SNLI against the Scramble Test challenge set.
dcterms:title: SNLI

dcterms:creator: I. Dasgupta
D. Guo
A. Stuhlm√ºller
S. Gershman
N. D. Goodman
dcterms:description: The Scramble Test challenge set contains samples that are changed in word order against the overlap bias in the SNLI dataset.
dcterms:title: Scramble Test

dcterms:creator: J. Thorne
A. Vlachos
C. Christodoulopoulos
A. Mittal
dcterms:description: The FEVER dataset contains pairs of claim and evidence sentences labeled as either support, not-enough-information, or refute. It is used to evaluate models trained on FEVER against the Fever-Symmetric datasets.
dcterms:title: FEVER

dcterms:creator: T. Schuster
A. Fisch
R. Barzilay
dcterms:description: The Fever-Symmetric dataset is manually constructed to reduce claim-only bias in the FEVER dataset.
dcterms:title: Fever-Symmetric
